intro: Ochlopoa annua subsp. raniglumis, commonly known as the slender annual grass, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural areas.
